a peer is someone with part of the file who also share their chunks they have

a seeder is a peer thats got 100 percent of the file

:O hope that clears it up?

a block is a blocked ip... it can happen if they add you to the utorrent ipfilter or use peer block

peer block tries to block known hostiles from connecting and seeing and logging your full activity

but more crucial it block the bad people dfrom sharing fake data with you slowing it down and wasting bandwidth

check you torrent tab summary you can see how much is wasted data.. meaning the data was damage you got

without peer block 1.1 (its free soft) google it
that waste can be very high
just load level 1 p2p ips if install it

wasted data can also happen if you drop connection and the person sending you a chunk of data is gone

or if someone hits and runs while sharing you a chunk but wasted hopefully will be very small amount or 0..
